wikipedia_page.main: Cecil Morton York (29 April 1857 – 23 February 1935) was a British actor of the silent era.Born Cecil Morton Smith in Kensington, West London, UK, he died at age 77 in Denville Hall, Northwood, London.

link_mentions.page: The Adventure of the Golden Pince-Nez
response: A short silent film adapted from the story was released in 1922 as part of the Stoll film series starring Eille Norwood as Sherlock Holmes and Hubert Willis as Watson, with Teddy Arundell as Inspector Hopkins, Norma Whalley as Anna Coram, and Cecil Morton York as Professor Coram.
